required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: In-use Study of Four Different Tampons
clinical_study.official_title: In-use Randomized, Cross-over, Controlled Double-blind Study of Four Different Tampons

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the impact on vaginal health of four different tampons using gynecologic assessment and subjective assessment of comfort during in-use conditions

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerance of Tampon Wear Via Physician Assessment of Vaginal Health
primary_outcome.description: The physician examiner determined tampon tolerance based on the following: 1) Vaginal erythema (0-4 scale), 2) vaginal lacerations (presence or absence), 3) vaginal abrasions (presence or absence), 4) vaginal pH, 5) vaginal discharge

secondary_outcome.description: Diary assessment of tampon wear comfort. This assessment uses a 5-point scale which was summarized using the mean as the summary statistic. This questionnaire measured overall comfort using a +2 to -2 scale that was converted to a 0 to 100 scale: 100 = excellent rating and 0 =poor rating

Post-menstruation assessment of tampon wear comfort. This assessment uses a 5-point scale which was summarized using the mean as the summary statistic. This questionnaire measured overall satisfaction using a +2 to -2 scale that was converted to a 0 to 100 scale: 100 = excellent rating and 0 = poor rating

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: This was a single center, double-blind 4 treatment, 4 period cross-over design. Each participant received each test product for one menstrual cycle.

group.title: Overall Study
group.description: This was a single center, double-blind 4 treatment, 4 period cross-over design. Each participant received each test product for one menstrual cycle.

outcome.title: Tolerance of Tampon Wear Via Physician Assessment of Vaginal Health
outcome.description: The physician examiner determined tampon tolerance based on the following: 1) Vaginal erythema (0-4 scale), 2) vaginal lacerations (presence or absence), 3) vaginal abrasions (presence or absence), 4) vaginal pH, 5) vaginal discharge
outcome.population: ITT population was the primary population of analysis. The ITT population was defined as those participants who were randomized, received at least one test product and had at least one post-product use measurement.
